<<<api>>>: LinkedHashMap
<<<code>>>: LinkedHashMap<String, String> sections;
sections = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
...
while(iter.hasNext()){
    Map.Entry<String, String> me = (Map.Entry<String, String>)iter.next();
    if (foundName == true){
        nextSection = me.getValue();
        nextSection = nextSection.toString();
        break;
    }
    if (sectionName.equals(me.getValue())) {
        foundName = true;
    }
}
...
if (ma.find() || line.contains(nextSection)){
    System.out.println("End of Section");
    sectionStarted = false;

<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are comparing a string (sectionName) with an object (me.getValue()). To fix this, you need to use the equals() method to compare the strings. Additionally, you can specify the types of the entries in the LinkedHashMap to ensure that the values are treated as strings.
